content: Microcontroller unit â€” a self-contained chip integrating a core (often ARM Cortex-M), flash memory, RAM, and peripheral blocks (timers, ADC, UART, SPI, I2C) on a single die. Runs bare-metal or RTOS code. Examples: STM32 (STMicro), ESP32 (Espressif). MCUs dominate IoT, automotive, and industrial control where cost, power, and determinism matter more than raw speed.
